title.narrative: Security Management and Protection for human Rights Defenders in Tanzania.

description.narrative: Tanzania Human Rights Defenders Coalition (THRDC) is a membership Organization in Tanzania with over hundred members both individual Human rights defenders and Human Rights Organizations membership working towards enhancing the security and protection of H uman rights Defenders in Tanzania. The vision of the THRDC is to envisage a free and secured working environment for the Human Rights Defenders in Tanzania. The mission of the coalition is that THRDC strives to maximize the protection respect and recogniti on of HRDs in Tanzania through protection capacity building and advocacy. The THRDC launched its Strategic Plan 2013 - 2017 in 2013.. For better implementation of the Plan the Coalition divided the plan into two phases (2013 - 2014 and 2015 - 2017 )The pla n became useful and contributed greatly to what the Coalition stands today.In 2015 THRDC requested the funds from the Embassy of Finland for better implementation of the second phase. The expected four outcomes are as follows, the legal and policy framewor ks addressing Human Rights defenders issues and CSOs networking improved, the media and HRDs capacity to effectively participate in the Human Rights Defenders protection processes and address their rights of human rights defenders improved, protection mech anisms established and accessed by HRDs at risk and improved performance and sustainability of THRDC.The main objectives of the activities are: to build protection and security management capacity of HRDs in Tanzania, to enhance the security and protection of HRDs in the country, to be able to evacuate and reallocate HRDs at risk, advocate for the recognition of HRDs in Tanzania through lobbying and advocacy worktarget groups in this project include, the most HRDs at risk such as Journalists HRDs Pastoralis ts HRDs Minority HRDs, Human rights lawyers, whistle blowers and women HRDs and HRDs working on natural resources
